title: How to Make a Metal Wire Flower Vase

steps.headline: Measure the height and width/circumference of the vase/jar(s).
steps.description: Add 1” to the height and 2” to the width/circumference. Measure twice and cut once!

steps.headline: Transfer measurements to your metal screening using your pen.
steps.description: Consider using a straight edge to keep lines straight.

steps.headline: Cut metal to size.
steps.description: By adding extra material, you should have some overlap around the width and height of the vase/jar. Remove/cut sharp edges, especially at the top and bottom of the vase/jar. Hold metal around the vase/jar.

steps.headline: Tie metal in place.
steps.description: Wind ribbon or yarn between openings in metal screen to tie the metal into place around the vase/jar. Tie it tightly enough so that the metal is so snug that it won’t move or slip off the vase/jar.

text: Measure the height and width/circumference of the vase/jar(s). Add 1” to the height and 2” to the width/circumference. Measure twice and cut once! Transfer measurements to your metal screening using your pen. Consider using a straight edge to keep lines straight. Cut metal to size. By adding extra material, you should have some overlap around the width and height of the vase/jar. Remove/cut sharp edges, especially at the top and bottom of the vase/jar. Hold metal around the vase/jar. Tie metal in place. Wind ribbon or yarn between openings in metal screen to tie the metal into place around the vase/jar. Tie it tightly enough so that the metal is so snug that it won’t move or slip off the vase/jar. Finished.
